data.text: But Job answered and said,
I have heard many such things:
What! is there any reason in vain words?
I also will speak as ye do:
And would there were strength in my mouth,
For if I should speak, I shall not feel the pain of my wound:
But now he has made me weary, and a worn-out fool;
My falsehood has become a testimony,
In his anger he has cast me down;
He has attacked me with the keen glances of his eyes;
For the Lord has delivered me into the hands of unrighteous men,
When I was at peace he distracted me:
They surrounded me with spears,
They overthrew me with fall upon fall:
They sewed sackcloth upon my skin,
My belly has been parched with wailing,
Yet there was no injustice in my hands,
Earth, cover not over the blood of my flesh,
And now, behold, my witness is in heaven,
Let my supplication come to the Lord,
Oh that a man might plead before the Lord,
But my years are numbered and their end come,
